  3/** @file    vsip/core/config.hpp

  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: configuration items.

  9
 10#ifndef VSIP_CORE_CONFIG_HPP
 11#define VSIP_CORE_CONFIG_HPP
 12
 13/***********************************************************************
 14  Included Files
 15***********************************************************************/
 16
 17#include <vsip/core/acconfig.hpp>
 18
 19#ifdef  _MSC_VER
 20
 21// Make sure we see the POSIX definitions from math.h.
 22# define _USE_MATH_DEFINES
 23
 24#endif
 25
 26#ifdef M_PI
 27# define VSIP_IMPL_PI M_PI
 28#else
 29# define VSIP_IMPL_PI 3.14159265358979323846
 30#endif
 31
 32#if defined(_WIN32)
 33// IPP on Windows uses __stdcall for all functions.
 34# define VSIP_IMPL_IPP_CALL __stdcall
 35#else
 36# define VSIP_IMPL_IPP_CALL
 37#endif
 38
 39// autoconf defines them
 40#undef PACKAGE_NAME
 41#undef PACKAGE_STRING
 42#undef PACKAGE_TARNAME
 43#undef PACKAGE_VERSION
 44#undef PACKAGE_BUGREPORT
 45
 46// Remove macros that autoconf sometimes defines.
 47#ifdef SIZEOF_DOUBLE
 48#  undef SIZEOF_DOUBLE
 49#endif
 50
 51#ifdef SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE
 52#  undef SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE
 53#endif
 54
 55#ifdef SIZEOF_LONG
 56#  undef SIZEOF_LONG
 57#endif
 58
 59
 60/***********************************************************************
 61  Parallel Configuration
 62***********************************************************************/
 63
 64#if VSIP_IMPL_PAR_SERVICE == 1
 65// MPI
 66
 67/// VSIP_DIST_LEVEL describes the implementations distribution support
 68/// level [dpp.distlevel]:
 69///  0 - distribution of data is not support (not a parallel impl).
 70///  1 - one dimension of data may be block distributed.
 71///  2 - any and all dimensions of data may be block distributed.
 72///  3 - any and all dimensions of data may be block-cyclic distributed.
 73#  define VSIP_DIST_LEVEL                3
 74
 75/// VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE indicates whether PAS or VSIPL++
 76/// algorithm for choosing segment sizes should be used.  When using
 77/// PAS, this must be 1 so that VSIPL++ and PAS agree on how data
 78/// is distributed.  When using MPI, this can be either 0 or 1, but
 79/// the PAS algorithm results in empty blocks in some cases.
 80#  define VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE 0
 81
 82#elif VSIP_IMPL_PAR_SERVICE == 2
 83// PAS
 84#  define VSIP_DIST_LEVEL                2
 85#  define VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE 1
 86
 87#else
 88// Other (serial)
 89
 90// In serial, Sourcery VSIPL++ supports block-cyclic distribution of data
 91// (across 1 processor).  While this support provides no additional
 92// functionality, it allows parallel programs to be compiled and run
 93// unchanged in serial.
 94#  define VSIP_DIST_LEVEL                3
 95
 96#  define VSIP_IMPL_USE_PAS_SEGMENT_SIZE 0
 97
 98#endif
 99
100#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_TUNE_MODE
101/// Setting TUNE_MODE to 1 disables the tunable_thresholds.  This
102/// allows benchmarks to be run without thresholds to determine
103/// cross-over points, which can then be used as thresholds.
104#  define VSIP_IMPL_TUNE_MODE 0
105#endif
106
107#endif // VSIP_CORE_CONFIG_HPP
